alert.note: Alert for Athens (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 1:42PM EST until February 20 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Hocking River At Athens affecting Athens County. For the Hocking River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Hocking River At Athens. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low areas, campground, and private camps along the river between Athens and Coolville begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM EST Saturday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 11/18/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight.
